Edna was great to work with and very responsive. There was an ice storm the day of our departure that coated the access stairway. It was icy enough that I wouldn't have tried to walk down it empty-handed, much less with heavy suitcases. I contacted Edna and within 30 minutes a guy showed up and scattered rock salt on the deck and stairs and when we loaded up our luggage about an hour later the ice was a non-issue.
If you’re going to Tahlequah and you want a private, comfortable and well-appointed place to stay give The Hideaway a try.

I honestly said "I think I could live here!"
This place is a wonderfully planned out small space. Hooks, shelving, nooks all in the right places. I didn't have enough time in town to fully enjoy this lovely home, but the time I did have just made me happy. Don't forget to peek under the stairs :)
I really enjoyed choosing from a nice selection of different pottery mugs for my coffee. Huge, beautifully tiled shower with no water issues was also very nice. Many of the switches in the home are labeled, which I very much appreciate.
Cozy, fluffy and warm bedding made for a great night's sleep. Plenty of space heaters available for any comfort level on cool spring nights.
The sitting area in the living space was great for reading next to a large clean window that brought the outside in. It was a bit cool for me to enjoy the front door chairs which listen into a gentle trickling fountain and nature calls of birds, but the indoor space was lovely, too.
I had been traveling a bit, so the washer and dryer were a big bonus to run a small load to get me through my next several days.
If you're away from your home church, I found Roots Church in downtown Tahlequah at the old Dream Theater to be a welcoming family on the Sunday I was passing through.
Close to the city and happenings and highways, yet a very quiet neighborhood secluded by the trees of the property. I really enjoyed being here and also knowing its history was pretty cool, too.
